main event: Observer in Gallup, New Mexico, sighted a spheroid-shaped object, orange in color, leaving a trail of white smoke and was in view for about 5 seconds.
interesting points: The object was observed in a clear twilight with no sound or odor noted.
It appeared spheroid in shape and had a luminosity like a 200-watt light bulb at 100 yards.
The trail of white smoke left by the object persisted for approximately 15 minutes.
The observer estimated the object to be about 50 miles away and between 6,000 to 8,000 feet in altitude.
The object was described as not as fast as a falling meteor, and it disappeared by fading out.
